title: In most anticipated series at Fenway in years, Red Sox faceplant against Yankees in opener
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Red Sox lost to Yankees 4-1 in a crucial series opener at Fenway Park.
Boston managed only two hits, missing key opportunities with runners in scoring position.
Defense faltered with three errors, including a costly catcher's interference by Carlos Narvaez.

title: Former Patriots DE Deatrich Wise Jr. suffers season-ending injury
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Washington Commanders DE Deatrich Wise Jr. suffered a season-ending left quad injury against the Green Bay Packers.
Wise, 31, will require surgery after attempting to block an extra point and being injured in the second quarter.
Wise, a former Patriot, joined the Commanders on a one-year, $3.25 million contract in March 2025.

title: When will Connelly Early pitch next for Red Sox? Alex Cora explains
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Connelly Early is a candidate to start Tuesday's game against the Athletics at Fenway Park.
Early impressed in his MLB debut with 11 strikeouts over five scoreless innings against the Athletics.
Alex Cora is considering Early and other young pitchers for upcoming Red Sox rotation starts.

title: Scott Boras says he, Alex Bregman are ‘waiting until the offseason’ before making opt-out decision
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Alex Bregman's agent, Scott Boras, stated they'll decide on his contract opt-out after the 2025 season.
Bregman, 31, signed a three-year, $120 million contract with Boston, including opt-outs after 2025 and 2026.
Red Sox President Sam Kennedy expressed surprise at reports suggesting Bregman may opt out of his contract.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Season 5 of 'Only Murders in the Building' featuring Martin Short, Steve Martin, and Selena Gomez is streaming on Hulu.
'Misery,' a Stephen King horror-thriller adaptation directed by Rob Reiner, is available on HBO Max.
'The Girlfriend,' a psychological thriller starring Robin Wright, is now streaming on Amazon Prime Video.

title: Patriots injury report: Christian Gonzalez, Keion White ruled out vs. Dolphins
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Patriots cornerback Christian Gonzalez and defensive end Keion White ruled out for Sunday's game against the Miami Dolphins.
Gonzalez suffered a hamstring injury in July and has not practiced since July 28; White is out due to illness.
Linebacker Marte Mapu and offensive tackle Morgan Moses are questionable for Sunday's game against the Dolphins.

title: With DC Terrell Williams out, who will be calling defensive plays for Patriots vs. Dolphins?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Zak Kuhr, Patriots inside linebackers coach, will call defensive plays against the Dolphins in Terrell Williams's absence.
Williams is away due to an undisclosed health matter; his current issue is unrelated to previous health concerns.
Kuhr previously worked with Mike Vrabel at Ohio State and the Tennessee Titans, gaining experience on defense.

title: Boston activist Monica Cannon-Grant to plead guilty in federal fraud case
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Monica Cannon-Grant plans to plead guilty in a federal fraud case weeks before her trial in Boston.
Cannon-Grant and her late husband were indicted for defrauding donors and misusing nonprofit funds for personal expenses.
The couple faced a 27-count indictment including charges of conspiracy, wire fraud, and false statements on mortgage applications.

title: Here’s what we know about Tyler Robinson, Charlie Kirk’s alleged assassin
author: The Associated Press
bullets: Tyler James Robinson, 22, was arrested for allegedly shooting Charlie Kirk at Utah Valley University, facing multiple felony charges.
Robinson, a third-year student at Dixie Technical College, became more politically active according to family, but has no prior criminal record.
Evidence includes Discord messages discussing gun acquisition and clothing matching surveillance images; motive linked to political disagreements.

title: 7 things to know about a pivotal Red Sox-Yankees series
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Red Sox and Yankees face off at Fenway Park with top wild-card spot in the AL on the line.
Lucas Giolito, Brayan Bello, and Garrett Crochet start for Red Sox, aiming to continue success against Yankees.
Yankees lead MLB with 249 home runs this season, highlighting reliance on power hitting for success.
